S. Partarrieu

Freshly arrived back in Paris!

Hey there. I’m a part French and Chilean engineering (probably better described as applied mathematics) student at Mines ParisTech, one of France’s top institutions for such things. The French higher education system is full of wonderful, if not distressing, peculiarities, so don’t be too surprised if some elements of my resume seem weird to you …

In any case, I’m interested in a great many topics, the latest being all things related to artificial intelligence, brain-machine interfaces, computational neuroscience, computational biology, proactive healthcare, wearable technologies, performance optimization, decision-making under uncertainty and the list goes on… Following one of these interests, I’ve just finished two back to back research internship within the Jia Liu Group and the Landau lab. Currently, I’m back in Paris working with Owkin, an innovative company in the AI/healthcare space. I worked, and am working, on loads of cool things I’d be happy to discuss. You should be able to check out some of these projects soon on my publications page ;). See ya!
